channel.title: [mac] java issues
channel.description:
just got a macbook pro last week, its on mavericks, blah blah.
trying to get arcanists to work. game is missing required permissions attribute to play.
tried removing java and running an older version, but it just shows 'missing plugin' on the applet itself. and other games on the fun orb website, just show the java loading screen, but don't load anything. >_<

item.title: [mac] java issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Vain_:

and I just create the /rscache/ there?

I don’t know for sure, but that should work.

Read full topic

item.title: [mac] java issues
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

and I just create the /rscache/ there?

Read full topic

item.title: [mac] java issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Mac computers running OSX Lion or above hide the cache directory by default, so right click on Finder, select “Go To Folder”, and enter “~/Library/Caches”.

Read full topic

item.title: [mac] java issues
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

i was using safari, and even when i did allow the applet to run, it didn’t do anything. some games will show the white java loading screen, some will show a white box with ‘error’ saying it’s missing the permissions attribute, and some are black screens that don’t load anything. :l

i’m now getting:

Error_loader_nocache - Unable to create cache directory.

Arcanists was unable to find a suitable place to store its temporary files. To solve this please either:

Log in to your computer as an ‘administrator’ user, and then try loading Arcanists again. This should give it sufficient access to create its temporary cache.

Or, create a new directory called c:/rscache or /rscache. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. Arcanists should then detect that directory and use it for its files.

If you are unable to do either of the above, then as a last resort you can tell Arcanists not to store any files on the hard disk. Please go to the Java Options page and try selecting ‘Unsigned applet using default Java’ from the dropdown. The disadvantage of this is the game will load more slowly and use more memory and may lack some features, so if possible use one of the top two solutions instead.

If problems persist then please refer to our technical FAQ which can be found in the FAQ section of our website.

Reload game (same server) · Reload game (random server) · Server list · Java options · Return to front page

where should the cache directory be on a mac? :L

i can play the game with unsigned, but it’s much slower. :[

Read full topic

item.title: [mac] java issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

The Mac is horrendous when it comes to loading applets, especially in google chrome. The loading screen doesn’t change because you need to allow the game’s applet to run through the security warning that should pop up when the game is loading. What browser are you using?
EDIT: You could also change your security settings for Java. Go to System Preferences, click on the Java icon, and go to the Security tab within the Java control panel.

Read full topic
